name: NewYorker
text:
The creation of the D.H.S. marked a shift in the way that Americans think and talk about the country, and about people: the nation used to protect itself against other nations, but now it had to fear individuals.
https://t.co/euI6JHsQBQ

name: NewYorker
text: "Racism alone could not explain what killed my mother," @KeeangaYamahtta writes. "It was the overlap of race, gender, and the aspirations to the comfort of a class that she poked around the edges of but could not ultimately break into." https://t.co/QLGcp3MKjE

name: NewYorker
text: The fight to protect L.G.B.T.Q. people from employment discrimination has been a long one. Two of the three people at the heart of the landmark decision did not live to know that they had won. https://t.co/Iidf47TRXb

name: NewYorker
text: In Waxahatchee’s newest release, “Saint Cloud,” the D.I.Y. fuzz that pervades her previous albums has given way to the unadorned sound of an older country-blues tradition. https://t.co/7wIRT2VfrR

name: NewYorker
text: The weekly New Yorker Crossword now comes in three levels of difficulty. https://t.co/PtiiOXH24c

name: NewYorker
text: Urgent questions of our public life involve crowds: their nature, their power, their perils, their inevitability. So do questions of what forms our society ought to take in the near future. https://t.co/Am3EUozHUx

name: NewYorker
text: “If we’re just going to use solar power instead of coal to run the same sad mess of unfair and ugly oppression, is it really worth it?” @billmckibben on the protests taking place across the United States, and why we must face our collective demons. https://t.co/9TQoWJUfKs

name: NewYorker
text: Locally run antibody studies are being carried out across Germany in an orchestrated effort to construct an over-all picture of the disease’s penetration in the country. https://t.co/LibtPAUT82

name: NewYorker
text: "If the country is burning, we can’t just be out here making jokes. We have a responsibility. We have to tell everyone that the fun and games are over." An interview with Desus and Mero. https://t.co/xogD1EVa0E

name: NewYorker
text:
How the civil-rights protests of the 1960s left a trail in the historical record, in the form of ineffective and forgotten commission reports that acted as alibis for governmental inaction. 
https://t.co/KCgP1iEmbD

name: NewYorker
text: .@bentaub91 reports on a team of deep-sea explorers as they set one of the last meaningful records on earth: a journey around the world and to both poles to reach the bottom of all five oceans. https://t.co/xGzM25Pohh

name: NewYorker
text: If you knew that you wouldn’t have to answer for your work, would you write more freely? The author Maxine Hong Kingston discusses her next big idea—a novel published posthumously. https://t.co/4RrmO9FdDp

name: NewYorker
text: In the years after her mother and eight other members of the Emanuel A.M.E. Church were murdered by a white supremacist, Reverend Sharon Risher rose above her doubts in humanity to become an activist against gun violence. https://t.co/7wcESVLGtS

name: NewYorker
text: In her new memoir, which swarms with fantasy, the poet @NTrethewey recounts her childhood in the Deep South and mourns the loss of her mother. https://t.co/Ax1biPTkJb

name: NewYorker
text: A Chinese college student's experience adjusting to life in the U.S. provides a window into how challenging it can be to overcome cultural stigma, or just personal resistance, when deciding to seek psychological care. Watch the new documentary. https://t.co/vl2lAVP3zj

name: NewYorker
text: A cartoon by Maddie Dai. https://t.co/D0FROEPCTr

name: NewYorker
text: From the depths of an old German military bunker, an eccentric Dutchman known as Xennt built a dark-web empire beloved by hundreds of cybercriminals. https://t.co/fn9Lkl7rO1

name: NewYorker
text: In the new documentary short "On Falling," three élite mountain bikers don’t talk much about their fear of falling. Instead, they describe riding the line between control and accepting the loss of it. Watch here. https://t.co/dMjHjIPNia

name: NewYorker
text:
In our Wednesday crossword, gizmo for making zucchini noodles: 10 letters.
https://t.co/tCeP4DIvVw

name: NewYorker
text: "Herbs are essential for cooking," @CharlotteMende1 writes, "particularly during a summer of staying put: they’re a holiday in a leaf." https://t.co/2Udx3cJ8ts

text: A very suspicious phone call. https://t.co/Vfer2eQAzF

name: NewYorker
text:
Mike Pompeo’s abrasive speech at the Nixon Presidential Library may have played to Donald Trump’s base, but it undermined long-term American interests, @wrightr writes.
https://t.co/i243CC3c1m

name: NewYorker
text:
A clinical psychologist on ideas for teaching during the COVID-19 crisis, and the ways in which parental stress can affect kids’ growth.
https://t.co/qcz2N3ebAK

name: NewYorker
text: "I'd breach the electric fencing just to feel anything anymore." The dogs open up in the latest installment of Barry Blitt's Kvetchbook. https://t.co/2wq0aTEVOt

name: NewYorker
text: In Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s recent rebuttal to Ted Yoho’s non-apology, she defended not only herself; she defended principle and countless women, David Remnick writes. https://t.co/HWdsdkly8S
